['Fumble - to handle something clumsily, often resulting in dropping or losing it.', 'Stumble - to trip or move awkwardly, as when handling an object without control.', 'Mishandle - to manage or treat with carelessness, risking damage.', 'Clumsy - lacking grace and coordination; prone to making mistakes while handling objects.', 'Slapdash - done in a hasty and careless manner.', 'Fumbling - clumsily touching or grasping something awkwardly with fingers, often resulting in dropping it.', 'Cumbersome - unwieldy or difficult to handle due to size or shape; can also describe the handling of objects that are hard to manage.', 'Bungled - handled badly and clumsily, leading to a mistake or failure.', 'Butt-headed - acting in a silly, careless, or thoughtlessly manner when handling things.', 'Clunky - awkwardly large or bulky; can also refer to the rough handling of objects due to their size and shape.', 'Fidgety - restless and unable to stay still while attempting to handle something clumsily.', 'Flubbed - made a mistake in performance or action, often through carelessness when dealing with an object.', 'Shambolic - chaotic and disorganized; can describe the handling of objects resulting from poor coordination.', "Clashy - producing a harsh sound when handled clumsily; it doesn't directly relate to physical handling but illustrates carelessness in usage.", 'Slip-up - an error or mistake made while attempting to handle something, often due to lack of attention.', 'Fiddlesticks - nonsensical or irrelevant actions that might lead to clumsy handling; colloquial expression for being unnecessary when it comes to precision in handling objects.', 'Gaffe - a social blunder; can apply metaphorically to the awkward handling of something, such as a gift or utensil at an event.', 'Blundering - acting thoughtlessly and carelessly, leading to mistakes in handling items or situations.', 'Clunky operations - performing tasks with poor coordination or inefficiency when dealing with objects; related term but not directly about hand-handling.', 'Thwacked - a colloquial term for being hit on the head, which could metaphorically relate to the clumsiness of handling an object that results in it hitting someone.']

['Royal Flush - The highest ranking hand in poker, consisting of Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and Ten all from the same suit.', 'Straight Flush - Five consecutive cards of the same suit.', 'Four of a Kind - Four cards with the same rank, not necessarily from the same suit.', 'Full House - Three of a kind and a pair in the same hand.', 'Three of a Kind - Three cards of the same rank.', 'Two Pair - Two sets of pairs within the same hand.', 'One Pair - Two cards with the same rank, not necessarily from the same suit.', 'Gross - Five cards of the same rank in poker.', 'Royal Straight Flush - A straight flush where all five cards are royalty (Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and Ten).', 'Straight - Five consecutive cards regardless of suit.', 'Flush - Five cards of the same suit but not in sequence.', 'High Card - The highest card when no other combinations can be made.', 'Pair Plus One (or Better) - A hand containing a pair and one additional card, also known as "two pairs."', 'Suit-Pair Hand - Five cards consisting of three different suits with at least two cards matching in rank.', 'Triplicate Royal Flush: The rarest poker combination where all five cards are royalty (Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and Ten) from the same suit.', 'Full-House Straight - Three of a kind and a straight within the same hand.', 'Two High Cards - A hand with two high cards but no other combinations.', 'Pair Flush: Five cards consisting of three different suits, including at least one pair in each suit.', 'Mega Straight: A straight that consists of the 13 highest-ranking cards (Ace through Ten).', 'Perfect Full House - Two sets of three and a pair, all from the same suit.']
